pull.title: Test: batch rpc with params
pull.body: Useful as an example and test case.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -45,7 +45,7 @@ def test_batch_request(self):
             # work fine.
             {"method": "invalidmethod", "id": 2},
             # Another call that should succeed.
-            {"method": "getbestblockhash", "id": 3},
+            {"method": "getblockhash", "id": 3, "params": [self.nodes[0].getblockcount()]},
comments.body:
Concept ACK on testing a call with parameters.
Though, you're calling into the RPC while building the query, which is a bit funny (but not a problem in practice as there is a well-defiend execution order).

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -45,7 +45,7 @@ def test_batch_request(self):
             # work fine.
             {"method": "invalidmethod", "id": 2},
             # Another call that should succeed.
-            {"method": "getbestblockhash", "id": 3},
+            {"method": "getblockhash", "id": 3, "params": [self.nodes[0].getblockcount()]},
comments.body:
doesn't reflect practical usage sure, but was a quick way to demonstrate how it's done, and exercise it :)

I was looking for an example and tests are the first place I look!
